019package org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc;
020
021import static java.lang.String.format;
022import static java.lang.System.arraycopy;
023import static java.lang.System.getProperty;
024import static java.lang.System.out;
025import static java.util.Objects.nonNull;
026import static java.util.stream.Collectors.joining;
027import static java.util.stream.Collectors.toList;
028import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
029import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
030import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.IncludeTaglet.ProcessMode.DEFAULT;
031import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common.SOURCE_PATH;
032import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common.createLineNumberFormatString;
033import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common.determineElementName;
034import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common.initHelperTaglets;
035import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.EMPTY_STRING;
036import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.EMPTY_String_ARRAY;
037import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.isNotEmptyOrBlank;
038import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.loadToString;
039import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.splitString;
040
041import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
042import javax.tools.FileObject;
043import java.io.BufferedReader;
044import java.io.File;
045import java.io.FileReader;
046import java.io.IOException;
047import java.io.Reader;
048import java.util.ArrayList;
049import java.util.EnumSet;
050import java.util.List;
051import java.util.Optional;
052import java.util.Set;
053
054import org.apiguardian.api.API;
055import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common;
056import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.JavadocError;
057import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit;
058import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
059import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.util.Template;
060import com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree;
061import jdk.javadoc.doclet.Doclet;
062import jdk.javadoc.doclet.DocletEnvironment;
063import jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet;
064
065/**
066 *  <p>{@summary This taglet allows to include the contents of an external file
067 *  into the JavaDoc documentation.} This is particularly useful when the
068 *  contents of resource files (like a DTD or an XML Schema) should be shown in
069 *  the documentation.</p>
070 *  <p>Usually, that file is stored somewhere on the
071 *  {@link Common#SOURCE_PATH SOURCE_PATH}; this means that a file is addressed
072 *  by its path name on the source tree. For example to include this file, the
073 *  path would be
074 *  {@code org/tquadrat/foundation/javadoc/IncludeTaglet.java}.</p>
075 *  <p>But additional roots can be provided through system properties, where
076 *  the name of the new root will be prefixed by
077 *  {@value #PROPERTY_INCLUDE_ROOT_PREFIX}, like
078 *  {@code org.tquadrat.foundation.include.root.resources}. To use this root,
079 *  prefix the path in the tag with {@code ${resources}}.</p>
080 *  <p>The file contents can be processed in some way before it will be
081 *  included; refer to
082 *  {@link ProcessMode}
083 *  for the details.</p>
084 *  <p>The use of this tag will look like this:</p>
085 *  <pre><code>&hellip; {&#64;include &lt;<i>filename</i>&gt;:&lt;<i>processMode</i>&gt;} &hellip;</code></pre>
086 *  <p>where the &lt;processMode&gt; can be omitted. If the given file does not
087 *  exist or is empty, nothing will be included, and no error message will be
088 *  issued.</p>
089 *  <p><b>Notes:</b></p>
090 *  <ul>
091 *      <li>If Maven is used, and the include file is not placed at the
092 *      {@code java} path (but on the {@code resources} path, for example}, it
093 *      is required to add the parameter <code>&lt;sourcepath&gt;</code> to the
094 *      configuration of the {@code maven-javadoc-plugin}, where the path of
095 *      the include file is added; otherwise, it will not be found.
096 *      Alternatively an external root can be used, as described above.</li>
097 *      <li>At default, Gradle adds only {@code *.java} files as sources for
098 *      the Javadoc task. To make other files available for the
099 *      {@code @include} tag, an external root should be used. This is
100 *      mandatory for files that are stored at the {@code resources} path.</li>
101 *      <li>In general, both Maven and Gradle may have funny ideas about the
102 *      source path, so the recommendation is to use an external root
103 *      always.</li>
104 *      <li>If the source of a class should be included, the path to the source
105 *      file is relative to the module directory, if one exists.</li>
106 *      <li>The {@code {@include}} tag is an inline tag; that means that the
107 *      contents of the included file will be seamlessly integrated into the
108 *      other text of the respective Javadoc comment.</li>
109 *  </ul>
110 *
111 *  @author Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
112 *  @version $Id: IncludeTaglet.java 976 2022-01-06 11:39:58Z tquadrat $
113 *  @since 0.0.5
114 */
115@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: IncludeTaglet.java 976 2022-01-06 11:39:58Z tquadrat $" )
116@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
117public class IncludeTaglet implements Taglet
118{
119        /*---------------*\
120    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
121        \*---------------*/
122    /**
123     *  The process modes for the included file.
124     *
125     *  @author Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
126     *  @version $Id: IncludeTaglet.java 976 2022-01-06 11:39:58Z tquadrat $
127     *  @since 0.0.5
128     */
129    @SuppressWarnings( "InnerClassTooDeeplyNested" )
130    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: IncludeTaglet.java 976 2022-01-06 11:39:58Z tquadrat $" )
131    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5", consumers = "org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc" )
132    public enum ProcessMode
133    {
134            /*------------------*\
135        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
136            \*------------------*/
137        /**
138         *  The default mode that is used if no process mode is given; the same
139         *  as
140         *  {@link #ESCAPE}.
141         */
142        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
143        DEFAULT
144        {
145            /**
146             *  {@inheritDoc}
147             */
148            @Override
149            public final String processFile( final String fileName, final Reader reader, final String... params )
150            {
151                return ESCAPE.processFile( fileName, reader, params );
152            }   //  processFile()
153        },
154
155        /**
156         *  HTML relevant characters will be escaped in the file contents, and
157         *  line breaks are replaced by the HTML tag {@code <br>}.
158         */
159        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
160        ESCAPE
161        {
162            /**
163             *  {@inheritDoc}
164             */
165            @Override
166            public final String processFile( final String fileName, final Reader reader, final String... params )
167            {
168                final String retValue;
169                try( final var bufferedReader = new BufferedReader( reader ) )
170                {
171                    retValue = bufferedReader.lines()
172                        .map( ToolKit::escapeHTML )
173                        .collect( joining( "<br>" ) );
174                }
175                catch( final IOException e )
176                {
177                    throw new JavadocError( format( MSG_ProcessingProblem, fileName ), e );
178                }
179
180                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
181                return retValue;
182            }   //  processFile()
183        },
184
185        /**
186         *  <p>{@summary The file contents will be included as is; this works
187         *  for really simple plain text files that do not contain any HTML
188         *  relevant characters, or for valid HTML snippets.}</p>
189         *  <p>Line breaks are ignored by HTML browsers; this means that a
190         *  plain text file will appear as a long single line.</p>
191         */
192        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
193        PLAIN
194        {
195            /**
196             *  {@inheritDoc}
197             */
198            @Override
199            public final String processFile( final String fileName, final Reader reader, final String... params )
200            {
201                final String retValue;
202                try
203                {
204                    retValue = loadToString( reader );
205                }
206                catch( final IOException e )
207                {
208                    throw new JavadocError( format( MSG_ProcessingProblem, fileName ), e );
209                }
210
211                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
212                return retValue;
213            }   //  processFile()
214        },
215
216        /**
217         *  The file contents is source code of some kind. It will be treated
218         *  as for
219         *  {@link #ESCAPE},
220         *  and additionally, each line will be prefixed with a line number.
221         */
222        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
223        SOURCE
224        {
225            /**
226             *  {@inheritDoc}
227             */
228            @Override
229            public final String processFile( final String fileName, final Reader reader, final String... params )
230            {
231                final List<String> lines;
232                try( final var bufferedReader = new BufferedReader( reader ) )
233                {
234                    lines = bufferedReader.lines()
235                        .map( ToolKit::escapeHTML )
236                        .collect( toList() );
237                }
238                catch( final IOException e )
239                {
240                    throw new JavadocError( format( MSG_ProcessingProblem, fileName ), e );
241                }
242
243                final var lineNumberFormat = createLineNumberFormatString( lines.size() );
244
245                var lineNumber = 1;
246                final var buffer = new StringBuilder( "<div class=\"source-container\"><pre>" );
247                for( final var line : lines )
248                {
249                    buffer.append( format( lineNumberFormat, lineNumber++ ) )
250                        .append( line )
251                        .append( '\n' );
252                }
253
254                final var retValue = buffer.append( "</pre></div>" ).toString();
255
256                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
257                return retValue;
258            }   //  processFile()
259        },
260
261        /**
262         *  <p>{@summary The file contents is source code of some kind.} It will
263         *  be treated as for
264         *  {@link #SOURCE},
265         *  but only the lines between a line starting with
266         *  {@value #SOURCE_SNIP_START}
267         *  and another one beginning with
268         *  {@value #SOURCE_SNIP_END}
269         *  or the end of the file.</p>
270         *  <p>The line numbers are as for the full file.</p>
271         *  <p>Additionally, a snippet can be selected by its index if there
272         *  are more than one snippet marked in the source file.</p>
273         */
274        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
275        SOURCE_SNIPPET
276        {
277            /**
278             *  Returns all snippets.
279             *
280             *  @param  buffer  The output buffer.
281             *  @param  lines   The lines of the file.
282             *  @param  lineNumberFormat    The line number format String.
283             */
284            private final void allSnippets( final StringBuilder buffer, final Iterable<String> lines, final String lineNumberFormat )
285            {
286                var lineNumber = 1;
287                var includeLine = false;
288                AppendLoop:for( final var line : lines )
289                {
290                    if( line.startsWith( SOURCE_SNIP_START ) )
291                    {
292                        includeLine = true;
293                        if( lineNumber > 1 ) buffer.append( "&hellip;\n" );
294                        continue AppendLoop;
295                    }
296                    if( line.startsWith( SOURCE_SNIP_END ) )
297                    {
298                        includeLine = false;
299                        buffer.append( "&hellip;\n" );
300                        continue AppendLoop;
301                    }
302                    if( includeLine )
303                    {
304                        buffer.append( format( lineNumberFormat, lineNumber ) )
305                            .append( line )
306                            .append( '\n' );
307                    }
308                    ++lineNumber;
309                }   //  AppendLoop:
310            }   //  allSnippets()
311
312            /**
313             *  Returns one single snippet, identified by the index.
314             *
315             *  @param  buffer  The output buffer.
316             *  @param  lines   The lines of the file.
317             *  @param  lineNumberFormat    The line number format String.
318             *  @param  index   The number of the snippet, with 1 for the first
319             *      snippet.
320             */
321            private final void oneSnippet( final StringBuilder buffer, final Iterable<String> lines, final String lineNumberFormat, final int index )
322            {
323                var lineNumber = 1;
324                final List<StringBuilder> snippets = new ArrayList<>();
325                StringBuilder localBuffer = null;
326                AppendLoop:for( final var line : lines )
327                {
328                    if( line.startsWith( SOURCE_SNIP_START ) )
329                    {
330                        localBuffer = new StringBuilder();
331                        snippets.add( localBuffer );
332                        if( lineNumber > 1 ) localBuffer.append( "&hellip;\n" );
333                        continue AppendLoop;
334                    }
335                    if( line.startsWith( SOURCE_SNIP_END ) )
336                    {
337                        if( nonNull( localBuffer ) )
338                        {
339                            localBuffer.append( "&hellip;\n" );
340                            //noinspection AssignmentToNull
341                            localBuffer = null;
342                        }
343                        continue AppendLoop;
344                    }
345                    if( nonNull( localBuffer ) )
346                    {
347                        localBuffer.append( format( lineNumberFormat, lineNumber ) )
348                            .append( line )
349                            .append( '\n' );
350                    }
351                    ++lineNumber;
352                }   //  AppendLoop:
353
354                if( index - 1 <= snippets.size() )
355                {
356                    buffer.append( snippets.get( index - 1 ) );
357                }
358                else
359                {
360                    out.printf( "Cannot include snippet %d, only %d defined\n", index, snippets.size() );
361                }
362            }   //  oneSnippet()
363
364            /**
365             *  {@inheritDoc}
366             */
367            @Override
368            public final String processFile( final String fileName, final Reader reader, final String... params )
369            {
370                final List<String> lines;
371                try( final var bufferedReader = new BufferedReader( reader ) )
372                {
373                    lines = bufferedReader.lines()
374                        .map( ToolKit::escapeHTML )
375                        .collect( toList() );
376                }
377                catch( final IOException e )
378                {
379                    throw new JavadocError( format( MSG_ProcessingProblem, fileName ), e );
380                }
381
382                final var lineNumberFormat = createLineNumberFormatString( lines.size() );
383
384                final var buffer = new StringBuilder( "<div class=\"source-container\"><pre>" );
385                if( params.length == 0 )
386                {
387                    allSnippets( buffer, lines, lineNumberFormat );
388                }
389                else
390                {
391                    try
392                    {
393                        final var index = Integer.parseInt( params [0] );
394                        oneSnippet( buffer, lines, lineNumberFormat, index );
395                    }
396                    catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final NumberFormatException e )
397                    {
398                        out.printf( "Invalid value for snippet index: %s\n", params [0] );
399                        allSnippets( buffer, lines, lineNumberFormat );
400                    }
401                }
402
403                final var retValue = buffer.append( "</pre></div>" ).toString();
404
405                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
406                return retValue;
407            }   //  processFile()
408        };
409
410            /*---------*\
411        ====** Methods **======================================================
412            \*---------*/
413        /**
414         *  Processes the given file.
415         *
416         *  @param  fileName    The name of the file to process; used for error
417         *      messages only.
418         *  @param  reader    The file to process.
419         *  @param  params  Optional parameters for the processing.
420         *  @return  The processed file contents.
421         *
422         *  @since 0.1.0
423         */
424        @API( status = INTERNAL, since ="0.1.0" )
425        public abstract String processFile( final String fileName, final Reader reader, String ... params );
426
427        /**
428         *  Processes the given file.
429         *
430         *  @param  file    The file to process.
431         *  @param  params  Optional parameters for the processing.
432         *  @return  The processed file contents.
433         */
434        public final String processFile( final FileObject file, final String ... params )
435        {
436            final String retValue;
437            try( final var reader = file.openReader( true ) )
438            {
439                retValue = processFile( file.getName(), reader, params );
440            }
441            catch( final IOException e )
442            {
443                throw new JavadocError( format( "Cannot open Reader on file '%s'", file.getName() ), e );
444            }
445
446            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
447            return retValue;
448        }   //  processFile()
449    }
450    //  enum ProcessMode
451
452        /*-----------*\
453    ====** Constants **========================================================
454        \*-----------*/
455    /**
456     *  The error message indicating a problem when processing the include
457     *  file.
458     */
459    public static final String MSG_ProcessingProblem = "Problems on processing '%s'";
460
461    /**
462     *  The prefix for the name of a property that holds the root for path of
463     *  an include file: {@value}. It will be set on the {@code javadoc}
464     *  command line like this:
465     *  <pre><code>-J-Dorg.tquadrat.foundation.include.root.&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;=&lt;<i>path</i>&gt;</code></pre>
466     */
467    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
468    public static final String PROPERTY_INCLUDE_ROOT_PREFIX = "org.tquadrat.foundation.include.root";
469
470    /**
471     *  The snippet end marker for source code: {@value}.
472     */
473    public static final String SOURCE_SNIP_END = "/\u002ASNIP_END\u002A/";
474
475    /**
476     *  The snippet start marker for source code: {@value}.
477     */
478    public static final String SOURCE_SNIP_START = "/\u002ASNIP_START\u002A/";
479
480    /**
481     *  The name of this taglet: {@value}.
482     */
483    public static final String TAGLET_NAME = "include";
484
485        /*------------*\
486    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
487        \*------------*/
488    /**
489     *  The doclet.
490     */
491    @SuppressWarnings( {"FieldCanBeLocal", "unused"} )
492    private Doclet m_Doclet;
493
494    /**
495     *  The doclet environment.
496     */
497    private DocletEnvironment m_DocletEnvironment;
498
499        /*--------------*\
500    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
501        \*--------------*/
502    /**
503     *  Creates a new {@code IncludeTaglet} instance.
504     */
505    @SuppressWarnings( "RedundantNoArgConstructor" )
506    public IncludeTaglet() { /* Just exists */ }
507
508        /*---------*\
509    ====** Methods **==========================================================
510        \*---------*/
511    /**
512     *  {@inheritDoc}
513     */
514    @Override
515    public final Set<Location> getAllowedLocations() { return EnumSet.allOf( Location.class ); }
516
517    /**
518     *  {@inheritDoc}
519     */
520    @Override
521    public final String getName() { return TAGLET_NAME; }
522
523    /**
524     *  {@inheritDoc}
525     */
526    @Override
527    public final void init( final DocletEnvironment docletEnvironment, final Doclet doclet )
528    {
529        Taglet.super.init( docletEnvironment, doclet );
530        m_Doclet = doclet;
531        m_DocletEnvironment = docletEnvironment;
532        initHelperTaglets( docletEnvironment, doclet );
533    }   //  init()
534
535    /**
536     *  {@inheritDoc}
537     */
538    @Override
539    public  final boolean isInlineTag() { return true; }
540
541    /**
542     *  Looks up the system properties for a root path for include files with
543     *  the given name (the full name would be the prefix
544     *  {@value #PROPERTY_INCLUDE_ROOT_PREFIX}
545     *  appended by the argument, separated by a '.'.
546     *
547     *  @param  variable    The name of the root path.
548     *  @return An instance of
549     *      {@link Optional}
550     *      that holds the path.
551     */
552    private static final Optional<String> rootPathRetriever( final String variable )
553    {
554        Optional<String> retValue = Optional.empty();
555        if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( variable ) )
556        {
557            final var key = format( "%s.%s", PROPERTY_INCLUDE_ROOT_PREFIX, variable );
558            final var fileName = getProperty( key );
559            if( nonNull( fileName ) ) retValue = Optional.of( new File( fileName ).getAbsolutePath() );
560        }
561
562        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
563        return retValue;
564    }   //  rootPathRetriever()
565
566    /**
567     *  {@inheritDoc}
568     */
569    @Override
570    public final String toString( final List<? extends DocTree> tags, final Element element )
571    {
572        var retValue = EMPTY_STRING;
573
574        final var tag = tags.get( 0 ).toString().trim();
575        final var len = tag.length() - 1;
576        final var prefixLen = getName().length() + 3;
577        final var contents = tag.substring( prefixLen, len ).trim();
578
579        final var parts = splitString( contents, ':' );
580        final String fileName;
581        final ProcessMode processMode;
582        final String [] parameters;
583
584        switch( parts.length )
585        {
586            case 0 ->
587            {
588                //---* No argument for the tag *-------------------------------
589                fileName = EMPTY_STRING;
590                //noinspection AssignmentToNull
591                processMode = null;
592                //noinspection AssignmentToNull
593                parameters = null;
594            }
595            case 1 ->
596            {
597                //---* Just the file name *------------------------------------
598                fileName = new Template( parts[0].trim() ).replaceVariable( IncludeTaglet::rootPathRetriever );
599                processMode = DEFAULT;
600                parameters = EMPTY_String_ARRAY;
601            }
602            case 2 ->
603            {
604                //---* A file name and the process mode *----------------------
605                fileName = new Template( parts[0].trim() ).replaceVariable( IncludeTaglet::rootPathRetriever );
606                ProcessMode p;
607                try
608                {
609                    p = ProcessMode.valueOf( parts[1].trim() );
610                }
611                catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final IllegalArgumentException e )
612                {
613                    p = DEFAULT;
614                }
615                processMode = p;
616                parameters = EMPTY_String_ARRAY;
617            }
618            default ->
619            {
620                //---* A file name and the process mode plus some parameters *-
621                fileName = new Template( parts[0].trim() ).replaceVariable( IncludeTaglet::rootPathRetriever );
622                ProcessMode p;
623                try
624                {
625                    p = ProcessMode.valueOf( parts[1].trim() );
626                }
627                catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final IllegalArgumentException e )
628                {
629                    p = DEFAULT;
630                }
631                processMode = p;
632                final var length = parts.length - 2;
633                parameters = new String[length];
634                arraycopy( parts, 2, parameters, 0, length );
635            }
636        }
637
638        if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( fileName ) )
639        {
640            if( fileName.startsWith( "/" ) )
641            {
642                //---* An absolute path based on an external root *------------
643                final var file = new File( fileName );
644                if( !file.exists() )
645                {
646                    final var elementName = determineElementName( element );
647                    out.printf( "Cannot locate the include file '%2$s' for '%1$s'%n", elementName, fileName );
648                }
649                //noinspection OverlyBroadCatchBlock
650                try( final Reader reader = new FileReader( file ) )
651                {
652                    //noinspection ConstantConditions
653                    retValue = processMode.processFile( fileName, reader, parameters );
654                }
655                catch( final IOException e )
656                {
657                    //---* Should never happen *-------------------------------
658                    final var elementName = determineElementName( element );
659                    out.printf( "Failed to include the file '%2$s' for '%1$s'%n", elementName, fileName );
660                }
661            }
662            else if( !fileName.startsWith( "$" ) )
663            {
664                //---* A relative path *---------------------------------------
665                try
666                {
667                    @SuppressWarnings( "resource" )
668                    final var inputFile = m_DocletEnvironment.getJavaFileManager().getFileForInput( SOURCE_PATH, EMPTY_STRING, fileName );
669                    if( nonNull( inputFile) )
670                    {
671                        //noinspection ConstantConditions
672                        retValue = processMode.processFile( inputFile, parameters );
673                    }
674                    else
675                    {
676                        final var elementName = determineElementName( element );
677                        out.printf( "Failed to include the file '%2$s' for '%1$s'%n", elementName, fileName );
678                    }
679                }
680                catch( final IOException e )
681                {
682                    throw new JavadocError( format( "Problems getting FileObject for '%s'", fileName ), e );
683                }
684            }
685            else
686            {
687                //---* Retrieval for the root path failed *--------------------
688                final var elementName = determineElementName( element );
689                out.printf( "Failed to resolve include file '%2$s' for '%1$s'%n", elementName, fileName );
690            }
691        }
692
693        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
694        return retValue;
695    }   //  toString()
696}
697//  class IncludeTaglet
698
699/*
700 *  End of File
701 */
